description: The U.S. government and private sector are trying to solve a thorny problem. North Korean IT workers and hackers are infiltrating Fortune 500 companies to fund the regime's nuclear weapons program.
title: North Koreans got jobs at Fortune 500 companies to fund the nuclear weapons program

description: IUDs are a safe and reliable form of birth control, but many people struggle to get simple answers about the device. NPR’s Ailsa Chang talks with Mia Armstrong-Lopez, who wrote about this for Slate.
title: Why are IUDs still such a mystery to women? Look at funding, doctors and politics

description: NPR is tracking elected Democrats who have weighed in on whether President Biden should remain in the race for re-election.
title: Who is backing Biden? We're keeping track

description: The San Diego sector is where most undocumented border crossings are occurring as temperatures rise. The result is migrants crossing through more remote, dangerous and even deadly parts of the border.
title: California aid volunteers prepare for a crisis as migrants cross during heatwaves

description: The young far-right politician Jordan Bardella could become France's next prime minister. At only 28, he’s free of political baggage, but some say he lacks real job — and life — experience.
title: A look at Jordan Bardella, the far-right 28-year-old who could be France's next PM

description: Artificial intelligence tech companies are refusing to abide by internet protocol when it comes to scraping data. Their ravenous scavenging behavior is upending the basic rules of the internet.
title: Artificial intelligence web crawlers are running amok

description: The Department of Education has received a record number of discrimination complaints, including from families of students with disabilities. Some families are waiting months, even years, for help.
title: More students with disabilities are facing discrimination in schools

description: Fourteen stolen sculptures are back in Cambodia after New York’s Metropolitan Museum of Art agreed to return them. Thousands of historical artworks are thought to have been trafficked out of Colombia.
title: Cambodia's difficult journey to get stolen sculptures back from the Met

description: U.S. employers added 206,000 jobs in June — a modest slowdown from the previous month. The unemployment rate inched up to 4.1%.
title: U.S. employers added 206,000 in June — a slowdown, but more than forecasters expected

description: The U.K. has a new government with a new prime minister as Sir Keir Starmer's Labour party sweeps to power in an historic election.
title: The U.K. has a new government with Sir Keir Starmer at the helm

description: Democrats and donors are watching to see how President Biden handles questions from ABC's George Stephanopoulos. If he struggles, it may fuel party anxiety about whether he should stay on the ticket.
title: President Biden's interview today is taking on outsized significance for his 2024 race

description: Chestnut ate 57 hot dogs in five minutes, beating a team of four soldiers who downed 49 total. He not only broke his own record, but nearly tied the Coney Island winner, who ate 58 dogs in 10 minutes.
title: Joey Chestnut, banned from Coney Island, takes his hot dog-eating skills to Fort Bliss

description: Jeff Bezos founded the e-commerce giant in his garage 30 years ago. NPR's Andrew Mambo talks with business reporter Alina Selyukh about how Bezos built an empire and what's next for the company.
title: Amazon is 30. Here's how a book store gobbled up all of e-commerce

description: The Wisconsin Supreme Court has reversed a 2022 ruling banning the use of ballot drop boxes in the swing state.
title: Wisconsin voters can once again return ballots by drop box, state high court rules

description: One focus of the probe appears to be on the World Anti-Doping Agency, which reviewed repeated positive drug tests by elite Chinese swimmers.
title: Justice Department opens a criminal probe of the Chinese Olympic doping scandal

description: The "vast majority" of the 17,000 people under orders or warnings because of the Thompson fire north of Sacramento were able to go home. But an intensely hot weekend could make things worse.
title: Most evacuation orders are lifted, but a Northern California wildfire is still burning

description: A new study suggests ants therapeutically amputate the limbs of injured buddies to save them. (Story aired on All Things Considered on July 2, 2024.)
title: Ants treat certain leg injuries with lifesaving amputations

description: Biden says he's staying in the 2024 race. If he changes his mind, these Democrats could be potential candidates, this year or in 2028. And, Labour gets a historic victory in the U.K. elections.
title: These Democrats could replace Biden. And, Labour wins U.K. election

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks to Mary Kate Cary, who wrote speeches for President George H.W. Bush, and Paul Orzulak, who was a Clinton administration peechwriter, about current presidential politics.
title: Post presidential debate: it's a remarkable moment in American politics

description: The next British prime minister will be Keir Starmer, from the center-left Labour Party. It was a near wipeout for the Conservatives -- the party's worst defeat in its nearly 200-year history.
title: A landslide victory in Britain for a party that hasn’t been in power since Tony Blair

description: After 14 years of Conservative rule, Britons elected a new prime minister and parliament dominated by the Labour Party, which hadn't won a national election since Tony Blair, nearly 20 years.
title: Britain swings to the center-left in historic U.K. election landslide

description: The Library of Congress has acquired the papers of Leslie Bricusse, the songwriter who gave us "Pure Imagination," "What Kind of Fool Am I?," "Goldfinger" and "Talk to the Animals."
title: Take a sneak peek into a legendary songwriter's creative process

description: This year's wackiness — notably from non-candidates renting campaign billboard space — is proving exceptional, and residents have flooded election offices with angry calls and messages.
title: With suggestive poses and pets, 'wacky' election campaigning tests Tokyo's patience

description: The historical quilting collective Gee's Bend has made colorful imagination for decades. Now, they are working to monetize their artistry.
title: Alabama quilters find ways to bring financial benefits to their community

description: As part of a weeklong series on new American citizens, Khadija Mohamed, who is originally from the Canada, explains what it means to her to be an American.
title: Stories of new U.S. citizens: A Canadian on what it now means to be an American

description: An employee who must work on a sixth day would be paid 40% overtime, according to the new law.
title: Greece's new 6-day workweek law takes effect, bucking a trend
